entries.meaning: Smoke used as a disguise, mask or cover, as of troops in battle.
examples: Ensign Whitely began to tell of the surprise encounter of Admiral Sprague’s escort-carrier force with the main battle line of the Japanese Navy off Samar, in a chaos of rain squalls and smoke screens.

entries.meaning: (figuratively) Anything used metaphorically to conceal or distract.
examples: All that talk is just a smokescreen to disguise the fact that he has nothing to say.
